Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the Mapping Police Violence database. So far this year, 214 Black lives have been lost during encounters with police, nearing the 264 killed in 2020.
Document Sources.Source Justification: database that focuses on nonfatal police encounters in the United States between 2017 and 2022

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The database found that in each year, over 300,000 people experienced use of force by police that includes chemical sprays, K-9 dog attacks, neck restraints, stun guns as well as beanbags and baton strikes. Black people are more susceptible to nonfatal police violence than being killed by police, the report found.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: released a new database Wednesday that focuses on nonfatal police encounters in the United States between 2017 and 2022
